intro: Phacelia cloudcroftensis, commonly known as Cloudcroft phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
